corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2 Records

extent.value: in 7 record cartons, 6 manuscript boxes, 3 half manuscript boxes, 2 flat boxes, and 5 folders in 1 shared oversize box

abstract.value: The Utility Workers Union of America Local 1-2 represents members working in the electric, gas, water, and nuclear industries in the New York area, with the bulk of their members employed by ConEd.  Local 1-2 evolved out of the Utility Workers Organizing Committee (UWOC) established by the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) in 1938.  The collection documents the origins of the Local and its expansion to include employees at companies other than ConEd; elections of officers and of changes to bylaws; various political parties within the Local, including the Justice Party, Members 1st Party, New Directions Caucus, Administration, and the Unity Party; and the planning of strikes and positions taken by different political parties within the Local on the strike or possibility of the strike, as well as picket duty lists, schedules, and photographs of demonstrations and rallies.  These materials date from 1927 to 2004, with the bulk of the materials dating from the 1960s to late 1990s.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2; WAG 131; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
The accession number NPA 2001.026 is also associated with this collection.

There have been a number of power struggles within the Local, between a number of officers and political parties.  One of the major points of contention was the trusteeship instituted by the National in 1998 due to alleged mismanagement of funds by the president of the Local, Joseph Flaherty.  The Members 1st party backed the trustee, James Keller, while the Justice Party wanted to gain control of the Local back from the National.

Struggles between various political parties within the Local are documented through notices, posters, and newsletters, with a large portion documenting the clash between the Members 1st Party and the Justice Party over the trusteeship of the Local.  Other political parties represented include the New Directions Caucus, Administration, and the Unity Party.

Series I: Bylaws0.2 Linear Feetin 8 file folders and 1 oversize folder1942-2001Arrangement

This series is arranged chronologically through the 1997 accession and then alphabetically by organization and chronologically within each organization.

Scope and Content Note

This series contains originals and photocopies of bylaws and proposed bylaws of Local 1-2, the Joint Council of Locals 1-2 and 4, and the Joint Council of the Brotherhood of Consolidated Edison Employees; a small amount of correspondence between Joseph A. Fisher, National President, and Edward M. O'Keefe, Secretary-Treasurer of Local 1-2, concerning changes to the Local's bylaws; correspondence and notices reflecting the use of bylaw changes by dissident groups within Local 1-2 to effect alterations in structure and leadership; and copies of the constitution of the Utility Workers Union of America.

Bylaws: Proposed Amendments1962-196611Bylaws: Proposed Amendments1984-198912Bylaws: Proposed Amendments199013Bylaws: Proposed Amendments199014Local 1-2 bylaws1942-1961MSXOS003141Local 1-2 bylaws1987-20014211Joint Councils bylaws1952, undated43Utility Workers Union of America constitution1946-199944Series II: Minutes0.7 Linear Feetin 1 record carton1963-1989Arrangement

This series is arranged alphabetically by type of meeting and chronologically by year within that arrangement.

Scope and Content Note

This series and is divided into two parts: minutes of Executive Board meetings and minutes of General Membership meetings, each of which reflects the varied political concerns (both internal and external), industrial issues, and bargaining points confronting the Local over the past three decades.

Material from the 1997 accession is arranged alphabetically by type of correspondence and chronologically within that arrangement. Material from the 2003 accretion is arranged chronologically by year.

Scope and Content Note

Most of the officers' correspondence has not been preserved. This series includes routine memoranda and publicity communications between the National Union, regional offices, and the Local; a very small amount of correspondence between Marshall M. Hicks, National Secretary-Treasurer, and different officers of the Local regarding financial transactions and creation of working papers; correspondence between members of the National, including Joseph A. Fisher, President, and Harold J. Straub, Vice President, and Oliver J. Harper, an attorney contracted to represent the National.

Correspondence: Officers1960-1987, undated148Correspondence: UWUA1958-1964149Correspondence: UWUA1966150Correspondence: UWUA1967-1968151Correspondence: UWUA, Region 11959-1961152Correspondence: UWUA, Region 11962-1968153General correspondence1939-200245Series IV: Election Records0.7 Linear Feetin 22 file folders and 2 oversize folders1940-2002Arrangement

This series is arranged chronologically by year.

Scope and Content Note

This series documents the contentious election history of the Local. Elections are well represented through leaflets, memos, clippings, ballot tallies, and official reports of arbitrators and court-appointed monitors. This series contains correspondence and memoranda between the locals, the companies, and the National Labor Relations Board regarding the planning of elections; notices of elections and election results; decisions of the National Labor Relations Board; notices with platforms and election slates for political parties within Local 1-2, including the Justice Party, the Unity Party, Members 1st Party, and Administration; lists of election observers; notices and posters for elections; polling lists; and election results. Correspondents include the Brotherhood of Consolidated Edison Employees; the Joint Council of Locals 1, 2, 3, 4, and 7; Consolidated Edison System Companies; Harold J. Straub; Elinore M. Herrick; Patrick McGrath; Augustus Low; Andrew McMahon; John C. Arnell; Edward L. Marsine; and Bernard E. Gallagher. Early elections are well represented, especially the 1940 election in which the Brotherhood of Consolidated Edison Employees became Local 1-2.

Election1960154Election1962155Election1968156Election1970-1971157Election1983159Election1986158Election1988160Election1989161Election (I)199021Election (II)199022Election199523Elections1940-200246-16Elections1940-1949, 1974, 1986-1992, 2002MSXOS0031-2Series V: Bargaining Records3.4 Linear Feetin 3 and a half record cartons, 2 oversize folders, 1 D-2 cassette, 1 VHS cassette, and 3 buttons1935-2002, undatedArrangement

This series is divided into the following subseries: Subseries V.A: 1997 accession; Subseries V.B: Contracts; Subseries V.C: Grievance Files; Subseries V.D: Mergers; and Subseries V.E: Strikes.

Scope and Content Note

This series contains correspondence, memoranda, minutes, booklets, pamphlets, notices, posters, VHS cassettes, and photographs documenting aspects of the Local's role in bargaining and negotiating on behalf of its members.

Subseries V.A: 1997 accession1.3 Linear Feetin 1 record carton and 10 folders1958-1993Arrangement

This subseries is arranged by document type and then chronologically by year within that arrangement.

Scope and Content Note

This subseries documents the major points of contention between ConEd and Local 1-2 through bargaining files, agreements and arbitration awards and reflect the continuing pressure from dissident groups against the leadership of the Local. Documents include leaflets, typescript memoranda, and reports calling on members to reject various packages proposed by the Local leadership.

Bargaining195824Bargaining (I)195925Bargaining (II)195926Bargaining (III)195927Bargaining (IV)195928Bargaining (Settlement)195929Bargaining (I)1961210Bargaining (II)1961211Bargaining (III)1961212Bargaining (IV)1961213Bargaining (V)1961214Bargaining (I)1962215Bargaining (II)1962216Bargaining (III)1962217Bargaining1963218Bargaining1964219Bargaining1965-1966220Bargaining1971221Bargaining1973222Bargaining1983223Bargaining1989224Bargaining1989225Agreement1983226Agreement1986227Arbitrations (I)1975228Arbitrations (II)1975229Arbitrations1976230Arbitrations1977231Arbitrations (I)1978232Arbitrations (II)1978233Arbitrations (I)1979234Arbitrations (II)1979235Arbitrations198031Arbitrations198132Arbitrations198233Arbitrations198334Arbitrations198435Arbitrations198636Arbitrations198737Arbitrations198838Arbitrations199039Arbitrations1992-1993310Subseries V.B: Contracts1.5 Linear Feetin 1 record carton, 13 folders, 1 oversize folder, 1 VHS cassette, and 2 buttons1935-2002, undatedArrangement

This subseries is arranged chronologically by year.

Scope and Content Note

This subseries contains drafts and printed agreements between Local 1-2 and ConEd; the Employees Representation Plans of Bronx Gas and Electric Company and Consolidated Edison Employees and the Consolidated Edison Company of New York; the Brotherhood of Consolidated Edison Employees and Consolidated Edison Company of New York; Joint Council of Locals 1, 2, 3, 4, and 7 and Consolidated Edison System Companies; and other locals and ConEd. Also included is a 1978 agreement between the Jamaica Water Supply Company and Local 1-2. The negotiations are documented through correspondence and memoranda between the locals, the companies, and the National Labor Relations Board regarding the creation of and deliberation around contracts and minutes of their negotiation meetings. Other items include payroll classifications and job titles booklets; lists of employees denied wage progression increases; issues of Bargaining Bulletin, The Record, and Utility Workers' Light; handbooks on mobilizing members; surveys of union members regarding where they work and what issues in the contract are important to them; notices to members regarding the contract process; newspaper clippings regarding contract negotiations; and buttons supporting ratification of different contracts. There are approximately 50 photographs of a rally held in Union Square, Manhattan in support of the 1992 contract.

Contracts, 1935-19531935-1953417-27Contracts, 1954-20001954-2000MSXOS0033, 551-1992112Contracts, 2000-2002, undated2000-2002, undated61-2Contracts--Buttons2000-2002813Subseries V.C: Grievances0.1 Linear Feetin 3 folders1969-1975Scope and Content Note

Mazzola, Frank T.197563-4Weidman, Frank J.1969-197065Subseries V.D: Mergers0.1 Linear Feetin 4 file folders and 1 oversize folder1945-2002Arrangement

This subseries is arranged in numerical order by name of local.

Scope and Content Note

This subseries contains correspondence, constitutions, and agreements of mergers between Local 1-2 and Local 4; Local 1-2 and Local 8; and Local 1-2 and Local 381.

Local 41945-1949, 1959-196166Local 8194667-8MSXOS0033Local 3812001-200269Subseries V.E: Strikes0.4 Linear Feetin 12 folders, 1 D-2 cassette, and 1 button1989-2002Arrangement

This subseries is arranged chronologically by year.

Scope and Content Note

This subseries contains material from all stages of the strikes, from proposal to planning to strike to resolution. Most of the strikes were in response to failed contract negotiations between Local 1-2 and ConEd, but some of the material documents Local 1-2 striking in solidarity with other unions, including the Communications Workers of America in 1989 and the Utility Workers Union of America, Locals 375 and 381 in 1998. This material includes Local 1-2 Bargaining Bulletins, notices, and posters communicating the position of the Local. Material regarding the planning of strikes includes picket duty lists, schedules, and other planning documents, as well as correspondence between officials from the Local and the National, ConEd officials, and politicians. Other materials include newspaper clippings and VHS cassettes with news reports on the strikes; photographs of demonstrations and rallies; and buttons documenting political parties and positions in regards to the strikes. There are three photographs from a strike in the 1990s which could not be positively dated and are filed at the end of the material.

Materials added to the collection in 2017 include additional photos, flyers, and a scrapbook related to the 1998 Local 381 Strike. They also contain videos of press coverage of demonstrations demonstration against Con-Edison and in support of the Indian Point Utility Workers Union (UAUW, Local 1-2), and a small assortment of bargaining agreements and bylaws.

This series is arranged alphabetically by subject, with material from the 1997 accession filed separately from the 2003 accretion.

Scope and Content Note

This series contains correspondence, newspaper clippings, newsletters, photographs, programs, and VHS cassettes regarding a number of topics, including different political parties within the Local, including Administration, New Directions Caucus, Members 1st Party, and the Justice Party; the trusteeship instituted by the National in 1998 due to alleged mismanagement of funds by the president of the Local, Joseph Flaherty; histories of the Local, ConEd, and other organizations; the 50th anniversary of the local; social events held by the Local; efforts by the Progressive Labor Party to influence Local members; Local financial records; legislative files; the Local's dealings with individual employers other than ConEd (small numbers of Local members were employed by private companies); and the 1940s detail organizing efforts within ConEd which resulted in the replacement of older company unions by the Brotherhood of Consolidated Edison Employees.

Utility Workers Union of America, Local 1-2

Scope and Content Note

The website of Local 1-2 of the Utility Workers Union of America includes information on their political action committee, their publication, The Record, images and other audiovisual materials, news listings, and event listings.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.

Series VIII: Conferences and Conventions Files0.5 Linear Feetin 1 manuscript box, 1 oversize folder, 6 1/4" audio reels, 9 audio cassettes, and 16 CDs1948-2003Arrangement

This series is arranged alphabetically by convention title and chronologically within that arrangement.

Scope and Content Note

This series contains correspondence and notices regarding election of delegates to UWUA National Conventions; agenda and minutes of conference sessions at the UWUA Nuclear Conference; and audio recordings of Educational and Regional Conferences held in 1964.

UWUA Constitutional Conventions are documented through proceedings, officers reports, and photographs. The proceedings include transcripts of remarks and reports given at sessions. The officers reports outline important issues facing officers between conventions, including contract negotiations, financial operations of the National Union, and educational, political, and health initiatives. The photographs document panels, attendees, speakers, and social events at the conventions.
